nl.tue.geometrycore.geometry.linear

Class Rectangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.tue.geometrycore.geometry.BaseGeometry<TActual>
      • nl.tue.geometrycore.geometry.CyclicGeometry<Rectangle>
        • nl.tue.geometrycore.geometry.linear.Rectangle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GeometryConvertable<Rectangle>

    public class Rectangle
extends CyclicGeometry<Rectangle>
    A simple axis-aligned rectangle class, particularly useful for computing bounding boxes. The box may be empty, by infinite boxes are not currently supported.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Rectangle()
      Constructs an empty rectangle.
      Rectangle(double left, double right, double bottom, double top)
      Constructs a rectangle from the given dimensions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rectangle

        public Rectangle()
        Constructs an empty rectangle.

      • Rectangle

        public Rectangle(double left,
                 double right,
                 double bottom,
                 double top)
        Constructs a rectangle from the given dimensions. Note that setting left higher than right, or bottom higher than top, yields an empty rectangle.
        Parameters:
        left - X-coordinate of the left side
        right - X-coordinate of the right side
        bottom - Y-coordinate of the bottom side
        top - Y-coordinate of the top side

    • Method Detail

      • byCorners

        public static Rectangle byCorners(Vector pointA,
                                  Vector pointB)
        Constructs a rectangle by specifying two diagonal corners.
        Parameters:
        pointA - one corner
        pointB - another corner, diagonal from the first
        Returns:
        the spanned rectangle

      • byCornerAndDiagonal

        public static Rectangle byCornerAndDiagonal(Vector point,
                                            Vector diagonal)
        Constructs a rectangle with a provided corner and a vector pointing from this corner to the diagonally opposite one.
        Parameters:
        point - a corner of the rectangle
        diagonal - the offset of the diagonally opposite corner
        Returns:
        the spanned rectangle

      • byCornerAndSize

        public static Rectangle byCornerAndSize(Vector point,
                                        double width,
                                        double height)
        Constructs the rectangle from a point with given width and height. Positive width, uses the X-coordinate of the point as the left side; negative width makes it the right side. Similarly, positive height uses the Y-coordinate as the bottom side; negative as top.
        Parameters:
        point - corner of the rectangle
        width - desired width
        height - desired height
        Returns:
        the spanned rectangle

      • byCenterAndSize

        public static Rectangle byCenterAndSize(Vector point,
                                        double width,
                                        double height)
        Constructs the rectangle from a point with given width and height. Using negative width or height results in an empty rectangle.
        Parameters:
        point - center of the rectangle
        width - desired width
        height - desired height
        Returns:
        the spanned rectangle

        Returns:
        smallest enclosing rectangle

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Vector point,
                        double prec)
        Description copied from class: CyclicGeometry
        Computes whether the provided point lies inside or on the boundary, with a given precision. A negative precision allows to check whether the point lies strictly inside, that is, not on the boundary.
        Specified by:
        contains in class CyclicGeometry<Rectangle>
        Parameters:
        point - location to check containment for
        prec - precision
        Returns:
        whether the point lies inside or on the boundary

      • isSingleton

        public boolean isSingleton()
        Checks if the rectangle is a singleton, with a precision of DoubleUtil.EPS. Note that this is strictly exclusive with isEmpty().
        Returns:
        whether the rectangle is a single point

      • reverse

        public void reverse()
        Description copied from class: CyclicGeometry
        Reverse this geometry from start to end, without changing its appearance.
        Specified by:
        reverse in class CyclicGeometry<Rectangle>

      • setWidth

        public void setWidth(double newwidth)
        Sets the width of this rectangle. Area is added equally to the left and right side. If the rectangle is empty, the left and right side will be negative and positive newwidth / 2.0. Note that this may still mean the rectangle is empty afterwards due to the vertical dimension. This way, calling setWidth() and setHeight() consecutively on an empty rectangle ensures that afterwards, the rectangle has the desired size and is centered on the origin.
        Parameters:
        newwidth - the desired width of the rectangle

      • setHeight

        public void setHeight(double newheight)
        Sets the height of this rectangle. Area is added equally to the bottom and top side. If the rectangle is empty, the bottom and top side will be negative and positive newheight / 2.0. Note that this may still mean the rectangle is empty afterwards due to the horizontal dimension. This way, calling setWidth() and setHeight() consecutively on an empty rectangle ensures that afterwards, the rectangle has the desired size and is centered on the origin.
        Parameters:
        newheight - the desired height of the rectangle

      • include

        public void include(double x,
                    double y)
        Performs the minimal extension, such that the rectangle contains point (x,y).
        Parameters:
        x - X-coordinate to include
        y - Y-coordinate to include

        Performs the minimal extension, such that the rectangle contains all provided points.
        Parameters:
        points - locations that must be contained by the rectangle

      • grow

        public void grow(double d)
        Grows the box in all four directions. Equal values all directions are used.
        Parameters:
        d - growth in X- and Y-direction

      • grow

        public void grow(double dx,
                 double dy)
        Grows the box in all four directions. Equal values for X- and Y-direction are used.
        Parameters:
        dx - growth in X-direction
        dy - growth in Y-direction

      • grow

        public void grow(double dleft,
                 double dright,
                 double dbottom,
                 double dtop)
        Grows the box in all four directions. Different values for each direction are possible.
        Parameters:
        dleft - growth to the left
        dright - growth to the right
        dbottom - growth downward
        dtop - growth upward

      • growToAspectRatio

        public void growToAspectRatio(Rectangle target)
        Performs the minimal extension to ensure that the rectangle has the same aspect ratio (defined by width/height) as the provided rectangle. This method has no effect when invoked on an empty rectangle or when an empty rectangle is provided. When providing a singleton rectangle, the aspect ratio 1 is used.
        Parameters:
        target - rectangle of which the aspect ratio is used as a target

      • growToAspectRatio

        public void growToAspectRatio(double desiredRatio)
        Performs the minimal extension to ensure that the rectangle has the desired aspect ratio (defined by width/height). This method has no effect on empty rectangles.
        Parameters:
        desiredRatio - the desired aspect ratio
